description: Find dependency issues in your Python project.

arguments.name: ROOT
arguments.description: Path(s) to the root directory(s) of the project to be scanned.

options.name: --config
options.description: Path to the pyproject.toml file to read configuration from.

options.name: --no-ansi
options.description: Disable ANSI characters in terminal output.

options.name: --ignore
options.description: A comma-separated list of error codes to ignore...

options.name: --per-rule-ignores
options.description: A comma-separated mapping of packages or modules to be ignored per error code...

options.name: --exclude
options.description: A regular expression for directories or files... [default: venv, .venv, .direnv, tests, .git, setup.py]

options.name: --extend-exclude
options.description: Like --exclude, but adds additional files and directories...

options.name: --ignore-notebooks
options.description: Boolean flag to specify if notebooks should be ignored while scanning for imports.

options.name: --version
options.description: Display the current version and exit.

options.name: --requirements-files
options.description: .txt files to scan for dependencies... [default: requirements.txt]

options.name: --requirements-files-dev
options.description: .txt files to scan for additional development dependencies... [default: dev-requirements.txt, requirements-dev.txt]

options.name: --known-first-party
options.description: Modules to consider as first party ones.

options.name: --json-output
options.description: If specified, a summary of the dependency issues found will be written...

options.name: --package-module-name-map
options.description: Manually defined module names belonging to packages...

options.name: --pep621-dev-dependency-groups
options.description: For projects that use PEP621... specify which groups under [project.optional-dependencies]... should be considered development dependencies.

options.name: --experimental-namespace-package
options.description: Enable experimental support for namespace package (PEP 420)...
